title: Gene expression in prokaryotes and eukaryotes

content.question: Which of the following best explains how the expression of a eukaryotic gene encoding a protein will differ if the gene is expressed in a prokaryotic cell instead of in a eukaryotic cell?

choices.label: No transcript will be made, because eukaryotic <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> cannot be transcribed by prokaryotic <math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> polymerase.
The protein will have a different sequence of amino acids, because prokaryotes use a different genetic code.
The protein will be made but will not function, because prokaryotes cannot remove introns.
The protein will not be made, because prokaryotes lack the ribosomes necessary for translation.

content.answer: The protein will be made but will not function, because prokaryotes cannot remove introns.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
